data.enText: worthier
worthiest
having the qualities that deserve sb/sth
to be worthy of attention

data.chText: 这份报告里有些调查结果值得注意。
data.enText: A number of the report's findings are worthy of note .

data.chText: 作曲家直到写出一部歌剧来才被认为是名副其实。
data.enText: No composer was considered worthy of the name until he had written an opera.
a worthy champion (= one who deserved to win)
He felt he was not worthy of her.

data.chText: 值得尊敬的；值得注意的；值得敬仰的
data.enText: having qualities that deserve your respect, attention or admiration

data.chText: 我们筹集的钱款将用于非常崇高的事业。
data.enText: The money we raise will be going to a very worthy cause .
a worthy member of the team

data.chText: 值得尊敬的，有价值的（但不太令人感兴趣或激动的）
data.enText: having good qualities but not very interesting or exciting

data.chText: 她那为人正派却呆板的丈夫
data.enText: her worthy but dull husband

data.chText: 有（某人或事物）的典型特征
data.enText: typical of what a particular person or thing might do, give, etc.

data.chText: 他作了一次典型的马丁∙路德∙金式的演讲。
data.enText: He gave a speech that was worthy of Martin Luther King.
deserving, or suitable for, the thing mentioned
trustworthy
roadworthy
-ies
an important person

data.chText: 当地知名人士参加的会议
data.enText: a meeting attended by local worthies

means: 有价值的(但不太令人感兴趣或激动的)
有（某人或事物）的典型特征

ex.chText: 这幅画可能价值数千英镑。
ex.enText: This painting is probably worth thousands of pounds.
This book is definitely worth reading.

ex.chText: 这次旅行很艰苦，但很值得。
ex.enText: It was a difficult journey, but it was worth it.

synonyms.bx: 具有介词性质的表语形容词，通常用在动词 to be 之后，其后应接名词、代词（宾格）、数词或主动形式的动名词。

ex.chText: 我们感到这次讨论很值得。
ex.enText: We felt that the discussion had been very worthwhile.

ex.chText: 这是一项值得为之奋斗的事业。
继续这个项目很不值得。
ex.enText: It wasn't worthwhile to continue/continuing the project.

synonyms.bx: 可作表语或定语，指某事物是值得的，或某事是值得花时间、金钱、精力做的，后接动词不定式和动名词均可。

ex.chText: 这部影片值得我们再看一遍。
ex.enText: This film is worth our while to see again.

tips.tip: 有时，worthwhile可分拆开来，中间插入所需要的物主代词。

ex.chText: 值得尊敬的冠军/对手/获胜者
崇高的目标/高尚的事业/有价值的生活
那是一项很有价值的工作。

ex.enText: The museum is worthy to be visited/of a visit/of being visited.

ex.chText: 当地政务委员们认为该规划值得支持。
ex.enText: Local councillors thought that the program was worthy of support.

synonyms.bx: 作定语时，主要用于修饰人或诸如事业、生活等抽象名词；作表语时，常后接被动语态的动词不定式，或介词 of 加名词或被动语态的动名词。

tr: an important, honorable person (word is often used humorously)
example: he told his story to some conservative worthies
local worthies rarely challenged the chief constable

tr: worthy of being chosen especially as a spouse
example: the parents found the girl suitable for their son

tr: having qualities or abilities that merit recognition in some way
having worth or merit or value

value.def: If a person or thing is worthy of something, they deserve it because they have the qualities or abilities required.

example.ex: The bank might think you're worthy of a loan...
example.tran: 银行也许会认为你具备贷款的条件。

example.ex: The Minister says the idea is worthy of consideration...
example.tran: 部长说这个想法值得考虑。

example.ex: I hope he was worthy of her.

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link ADJ, usu ADJ <l>of</l> n

example.ex: I have not achieved my goal in becoming chief constable, a rank I know I could have worthily held.
example.tran: 我没有实现当警察局局长的目标，但我知道自己已经能够胜任这个职位。

example.ex: Some people are afraid to take risks because their belief in their own worthiness is so low.
example.tran: 有些人害怕冒险, 因为他们妄自菲薄。

value.def: A worthy person or thing is approved of by most people in society and considered to be morally respectable or correct.

example.ex: They thought the feminist label was too worthy.
example.tran: 他们觉得女权主义者这个称谓太抬举她们了。

posc.def: You can refer to worthy people as worthies .
posc.tran: 贤达;可敬的人;高尚的人

example.ex: ...the commission, which brought together worthies from big corporations, universities and state governments.
example.tran: 汇聚了大公司、大学和州政府中贤达人士的委员会

value.tran: 值得尊敬的;可敬的；令人称许的
